input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: Um, I’m here because I haven’t started my period yet, and I’ve been getting cramps in my lower tummy sometimes. My parents say I’ve never noticed any discharge or anything, and I guess I just want to figure out why. It kind of makes me nervous.
output:
THINKING: The patient mentioned she has not started her period yet, has experienced occasional lower abdominal cramps, and has not noticed any vaginal discharge. These are the confirmed facts from this session, and there are no new details to add to the previous vignette.  
ANSWER: The patient is a female who has not yet started menstruating. She reports experiencing occasional cramps in her lower abdomen. She has not noticed any vaginal discharge. She is concerned and nervous about these symptoms.
